code_value: The Winter Olympics, which are also called the White Olympics, are held every four years. The first Winter Olympics were held as a separate competition in France in 1924. At this time, many colorful stamps are published to mark the great games. The first stamp marking the opening of the Winter Olympics was issued on January 25, 1932 in the United States to celebrate the third Winter Olympics. From then on, issuing stamps for the Winter Olympics became a tradition. People can enjoy the beauty of the Olympics from the stamps.
